intro: Distictis, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, many of which are cultivated for their ornamental value. The plants typically have basal leaves and produce showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white or pink petals. They are often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. Distictis species are generally drought-tolerant and require well-drained soil for optimal growth.
